intro: Helixanthera somalensis, commonly known as the Somali helixanthera, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation in extreme environments.
